pick-a-color-or-clear-shift: Pick a color or clear with [Shift]
select-schema-group: Select schema group from the list
name: Name

properties.SQLITE_OPEN_READONLY-description: The database is opened in read-only mode. If the database does not already exist, an error is returned.
properties.SQLITE_OPEN_READWRITE-description: The database is opened for reading and writing if possible, or reading only if the file is write protected by the operating system. In either case the database must already exist, otherwise an error is returned. For historical reasons, if opening in read-write mode fails due to OS-level permissions, an attempt is made to open it in read-only mode.
properties.SQLITE_OPEN_CREATE-description: The database is opened for reading and writing, and is created if it does not already exist.
properties.SQLITE_OPEN_FULLMUTEX-description: The new database connection will use the „serialized” threading mode. This means the multiple threads can safely attempt to use the same database connection at the same time. (Mutexes will block any actual concurrency, but in this mode there is no harm in trying.)
properties.SQLITE_OPEN_URI-description: The filename can be interpreted as a URI if this flag is set.
properties.SQLITE_OPEN_SHAREDCACHE-description: The database is opened shared cache enabled, overriding the default shared cache setting provided by sqlite3_enable_shared_cache(). The use of shared cache mode is discouraged and hence shared cache capabilities may be omitted from many builds of SQLite. In such cases, this option is a no-op.
properties.SQLITE_OPEN_PRIVATECACHE-description: The database is opened shared cache disabled, overriding the default shared cache setting provided by sqlite3_enable_shared_cache().

properties.driver-fetch_record_count-description: Set the number of records fetched by the cursor, default 100

pool.title: Pool
pool.description: Enable connection pooling. Set specific properties.

properties.connectionTimeoutMillis-description: Number of milliseconds to wait before timing out when connecting a new client, default is 0, meaning no timeout
properties.idleTimeoutMillis-description: Number of milliseconds a client must sit idle in the pool before being disconnected from the backend and discarded, default is 10000 (10 seconds) - set to 0 to disable automatic disconnection of idle clients
properties.max-description: Maximum number of clients the pool should contain, default is 10.
properties.allowExitOnIdle-description: Setting 'allowExitOnIdle: true' in the configuration will allow the Node event loop to exit as soon as all clients in the pool are idle, even if their socket is still open to the Postgres server. This can be useful in scripts and tests where you don't want to wait for clients to become idle before ending the process.

properties.connectionTimeoutMillis-description: Number of milliseconds to wait for a connection, default is no timeout
properties.lock_timeout-description: Number of milliseconds a query can be in a lock state before being canceled due to lock timeout
properties.query_timeout-description: Number of milliseconds before a query call times out, default is no timeout
properties.statement_timeout-description: Number of milliseconds before a statement in a query times out, default is no timeout
properties.idle_in_transaction_session_timeout-desc: Number of milliseconds before any session with an open idle transaction is terminated, default is no timeout

properties.driver-extend_info-description: Fetch extended information about executed queries, e.g., field information
properties.driver-fetch_record_count-description: Set the number of records fetched by the cursor, default is 100
properties.driver-max_statement_rows-description: Set the number of records fetched by a query, default is 10000
